alert.note: Alert for South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 9:38PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Linn and north central Lane Counties through 1015 PM PDT... At 938 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Santa Clara, or near Eugene, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eugene, Junction City, Santa Clara, River Road and Coburg. In Oregon this includes Interstate 5 between mile markers 199 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
